timeline.bodyText: Not blocking this, but how about less redundancy by moving the WebBrowser to a field?
timeline.author: joheriks

timeline.bodyText: Couldn't all these if (browserDetails == null) guards be removed if the browserDetails field was initialized with a default value (in which all fields are anyway false or -1).
timeline.author: joheriks

replies.bodyText:
That was my original intention.
But then I've realized that there is already a plenty of methods which has impl with checking browserDetails == null.
So I decided to follow the existing pattern because:

I'm too lazy to rewrite all the existing code
even though I was sure that the new code that I was going to write will work correctly I was not sure that the existing code won't be broken with the default initialization like new BrowserDetails("");.
decided to keep have consistent code
replies.author: denis-anisimov

timeline.message: Use once initialized field instead of local variable.
